ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I truly learned so much about design on the web and current internet trends.
HTML, JS, CSS coding skills. Knowledge of how to use Arena and other website/media gathering tools. Exposure to a lot of cool web art and the history of the internet as a technology and an art
I got so much more comfortable with ideating ideas for the website format, its potential, and how to work through coding / structuring problems.
Learned basic coding (HTML, CSS, some Javascript). Developed a greater understanding of the history of the internet and how people have used it for creative purposes and community.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Rosa was so understanding to the people that were coding beginners.

This was probably one of the most organized design classes I've taken at Yale. I learned a lot from the core three projects (web zine, public installation, and website for one). Each project was unique and had you think through who your audience is, and details in interaction design. I also liked how in terms of class critique, there was a mix of both verbal feedback and also silent feedback (google forms) for less outspoken students.

Strengths: The assignments provide a good scaffolding, building on each other. They also prompt students to think critically about the web and how it can be used in non-traditional ways. The structure of the class and the use of a class site was helpful in staying organized and meeting goals. 

Weaknesses: Too many students in the class. Class is design-oriented and somewhat crit-based, but many students come into the class without a basis for understanding how to critique visual workpossibly a short intro to critique could help shape future discussions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! If you want to learn about the website as an artistic medium and gain some useful artistic coding skills
Absolutely, I think it's especially helpful for anyone looking to think more deeply about the poetic potential of the web, as well as creative web design.

Yes, I would recommend this course to students who want to develop coding and digital design skills and learn more about the internet. Previous coding experience was not a requirement. I do think some experience with web design or visual design is helpful.
